wikipedia_page.main: William Scammell (2 January 1939, in Southampton – 29 November 2000) was a British poet.

response: *Cholmondeley Award: Basil Bunting, Herbert Lomas, William Scammell

*William Scammell, an English poet, critic and biographer of Keith Douglas, was born in Hythe in 1939. A commemorative plaque, provided by the Parish Council, can be seen on the house in Alexandra Road, where he was born and lived until 1953. He died in 2000, aged 60.
* Cholmondeley Award: Basil Bunting, Herbert Lomas, William Scammell
*William Scammell, poet, was born in Southampton
